subject: RE: [junit] parameterized test cases, test reporting, and CruiseControl
msgSnippet: By message do you mean the text passed into the assert* method?  I guess that would make its way into the CruiseControl test report.  I ll try that, too.

By "message" do you mean the text passed into the assert* method?  I
guess that would make its way into the CruiseControl test report.  I'll
try that, too.
 
 
Todd.


________________________________

	From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of James Abley
	Sent: Wednesday, March 14, 2007 1:44 PM
	To: junit@yahoogroups.com
	Subject: Re: [junit] parameterized test cases, test reporting,
and CruiseControl
	
	

	I've always found using the message is sufficient to let me know
which one
	failed; using JUnit 3.8.x or 4.x.
	
	I'd be interested in learning more if this doesn't satisfy your
requirement.
	
	Cheers,
	
	James
	
	On 13 Mar 2007 15:30:29 -0700, Jeffrey Fredrick
<jeffrey.fredrick@... <mailto:jeffrey.fredrick%40gmail.com> >
	wrote:
	>
	> Interesting question. Does the Ant xml output give any
information to
	> distinquish between them?
	>
	> One idea might be to use the optional message parameter on
asserts,
	> but that doesn't help you if there is an expected exception.
	>
	> Perhaps you could override TestCase.getName() to indicate
which set of
	> parameters are being used?
	>
	> Jtf
	>
	> On 3/13/07, Bradley, Todd <todd.bradley@...
<mailto:todd.bradley%40polycom.com> <todd.bradley%40polycom.com>>
	> wrote:
	> > Hi, I was teaching one of my coworkers how to create a
parameterized
	> > test case to solve some of his problems, but he asked me a
zinger. How
	> > will I know when I look at the CruiseControl test results
page which
	> > test instance goes with which parameters? I didn't really
know.
	> >
	> > We're using CruiseControl and JUnit 3.8. The default Test
Results page
	> > just shows the name of the test methods, their status
(Success, Failure,
	> > or Error), and how long they took to run. But if he's got a
suite of 20
	> > instances of the same test (just with different constructor
arguments)
	> > how can he tell which one it was that failed?
	> >
	>
	> --
	> http://www.developertesting.com/
<http://www.developertesting.com/> 
	> http://www.junitfactory.com <http://www.junitfactory.com> 
	> 
	>
